value:
I was told I must wear this outfit to
participate in the festival. It wouldn't
be my first choice of attire...

Soldiers don't have the luxury of
choosing their battlefields. This isn't
my first fight in arid conditions.

The festival atmosphere is lively and
fun, but the bloodlust...is palpable.

This festival isn't a game. I'm here
to prove my strength in gladiatorial
combat. No one will stop me.

I don't need anyone cheering me on.
But I won't try to stop you, either.

I have a message for you. This is
it: there's a festival in full swing at
$Nf's castle.

Are they all cheering for me? Huh.
What an odd thing to hear.

This is just a festival? Maybe. But the
combat's real. I'm not going to take it
easy on you.
Ugh. I'm better than this...

Something that can help me during
my fights? I'd be a fool to say no.

I'm Deen. I've heard Hatari's a place
where people like me can enjoy a
show of strength.

Whenever I swing my blade, death's
at hand. Either my opponent's gonna
lose their life, or I am.$k$pA soldier has kill to live. The longer
you survive, the more blood you
get on your hands.$k$pThis festival's different though. Here,
the loser lives to fight again. Just with
a well-bruised ego.$k$pI didn't respect my opponents at first.
But now I get that there's merit to
sparring and not dueling to the death.$k$pMy opponents took me seriously, and
were proud to test their skill against
mine. They taught me to do the same.$k$pThis festival has made me reconsider
what it means to have strength, and
I'll always be grateful for that.
せやっ
どけ
ぐあっ…
やるな…
Playtime's over!
Nothing personal.
Learn to fight!
Enough messing around.
I wasn't enough...
ふん…
Here, I get to test myself against the best of the best. It's a fair reward for enduring the crowds.
I know the festival's exciting, but go be excited somewhere else.
The Hatari queen's strength is clear from her gaze alone.
My clothing? I'm told it's from a place called Hatari.
Princess Celica was all smiles when she heard I'd be here for the festival.
I used to enjoy this sort of thing, but those days are long gone.
You really are having fun, huh? Well, that's good enough for me.
No problem.
What next?
They won't stop me.
